channel.title: Camps on Coding and Math Classes and Tutoring in Charlottesville
channel.description: Recent content in Camps on Coding and Math Classes and Tutoring in Charlottesville

item.title: Coding Summer Camp Schedule in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Time Activity  9:00 –  9:10 Arrival  9:10 –  9:30 Team Building  9:30 – 10:30 Coding 10:30 – 10:50 Snack 10:50 – 11:40 Lego building and coding 11:40 – 12:00 Snack 12:00 – 12:30 Choice activity 12:30 – 1:00 Math puzzles 1:00 pm Dismissal Team Building Activities We start each camp day with a team-building activity. The daily activities are listed below. Day 1. For the first 15 minutes, using the LEGO bricks, students build a model that shows something they like to do and one thing they hope to learn during summer camp.

item.title: Contest Math Camp | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: 29 July – 2 August; Ages 10 to 13 Mornings 8:30 am to 1:00 pm Full Day 8:30 am to 5:00 pm Early Bird Discounts: Full-Day Mornings Afternoons Reserve and Pay Later: Full-Day Mornings Afternoons Explore the rich world of problem-solving with the "Art of Problem Solving, Volume 1: The Basics" book, a comprehensive resource designed to stretch and enhance the mathematical abilities of students in middle and high school.

item.title: Gadgets and Games Camp with Vex GO | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 17 – 21 June; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 8 and 9. At the STEM Gadgets and Games camp, our goal is to ignite passion for science, technology, engineering, and mathematics through hands-on, interactive learning. Campers will delve into the mechanics behind everyday gadgets, games, and toys by using VEX GO kitsâ€”innovative tools designed to foster creativity and problem-solving skills.

item.title: Game Design in Unity | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 29 July – 2 August; 1 pm to 5:00 pm; Ages 10 to 13. Game Design in Unity teaches the fundamentals of designing a game using the most widely accessed and preferred editing engine in the world. The intent of this course is to prepare campers with the industry related skills needed for the workplace and higher learning environments. By the end of this course, they will understand the design planning process, be able to navigate the Unity environment in order to create 3D games, and create their own game as a course project.

item.title: Intro to Computer Science with Minecraft | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 17 – 21 June; 8:30 am to 1 pm; Ages 10 to 13. Introduction to Computer Science with MakeCode for Minecraft is an educational course designed to merge the creative allure of Minecraft with the foundational principles of computer science. Using Microsoft's MakeCode, a block-based coding platform, students are empowered to write code that manipulates and interacts with the Minecraft world.

item.title: Intro to Computer Science with Minecraft | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 17 – 21 June; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 8 and 9. Introduction to Computer Science with MakeCode for Minecraft is an educational course designed to merge the creative allure of Minecraft with the foundational principles of computer science. Using Microsoft's MakeCode, a block-based coding platform, students are empowered to write code that manipulates and interacts with the Minecraft world.

item.title: Introduction to Game Design with JavaScript | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 22 – 26 July; 1 pm to 5:00 pm; Ages 10 to 13. Introduction to Computer Science in C++ is a course that focuses on broad computer science concepts such as input/output, variables, control statements, and basic data structures. Campers develop problem-solving skills through real-world assignments and projects. As an introductory level course, no prior computer science experience is required.

item.title: Introduction to Game Design with JavaScript | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 8 – 12 July; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 10 to 13. Introduction to Game Design with JavaScript is a course that introduces campers to game design and programming. Campers use the p5play JavaScript library in order to design, develop, and publish games. Throughout the course, campers learn about major programming topics like variables, functions, conditionals, and mouse/keyboard events while building fun and interactive games that they can play and share with others.

item.title: Lego Safari | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 24 – 28 June; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm<; Ages 6 and 7. This 5-day camp is designed to immerse students in the worderful world of animals. Students learn to work together to create Lego models of animals. Daily Schedule Time Activity  8:30 –  9:00 Arrival  9:00 –  10:30 Guided Learning Session Monday: Girrafe Tuesday: Bull

item.title: Lego Space Exploration | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 10 – 14 June; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm. Ages 6 and 7. Each day, students will participate in team building activities and opportunities for physical activity as well as receive a mission briefing for daily challenges aligned to standards. Daily challenges will help students develop skills and knowledge to complete the culminating project, to design a base in space.

item.title: Let the Games Begin! Camp with Lego Spike Prime | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 10 – 14 June; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 8 and 9. This 5-day camp is designed to immerse students in an engaging STEAM-centric environment, offering practical experiences that enhance their skills in the areas of science, technology, engineering, the arts, and mathematics. The program emphasizes the development of 21st-century competencies, including social and emotional learning, foundational principles of computational thinking, beginner-level coding, mathematics, and language arts.

item.title: Living in Space | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 12 – 16 August; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm. Ages 6 and 7. Perfect for kids aged 6-7, this exciting camp combines the creative power of LEGO with the thrilling world of space exploration. Campers will build and program their own space-themed robots using LEGO WeDo kits, engage in team missions that simulate real-life space challenges, and learn about the science of space travel from expert STEM educators.

item.title: Math and Coding Camps in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Morning Camps Ages 6 to 10: Come to learn to code using Scratch or Coffee Script, build Lego® robots and solve math puzzles! The activities do not repeat; students may join us for one, two, or all three weeks! Session 1: 9 am to 1 pm, July 24th to July 28th (2 spots remaining) Session 2: 9 am to 1 pm, July 31st to August 4th (full) Session 3: 9 am to 1 pm, August 7th to August 11th (1 spot remaining) Click here for daily schedule and activities!

item.title: Math and Coding Camps in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Unleash Your Creativity with Lego Robotics: Winter 2023 Camp Adventure! Are you ready to embark on an extraordinary journey of creativity, innovation, and teamwork? Look no further! Join us for an exhilarating exploration of Lego robots using the cutting-edge Spike Prime or Spike Essential. This winter camp is designed for Lego enthusiasts aged six to twelve, where imagination knows no bounds! At our Lego Robotics Winter Camp, students have the freedom to choose from existing Lego projects or unleash their creativity by building their own unique models.

item.title: Math Camp | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 29 July – 2 August; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 6 and 7. In the morning, campers unlock the World of Math with Beast Academy Puzzles 1! ðŸŒŸ Puzzles range from easy starters to challenging enigmas that promise to keep both young learners and adults thoroughly engaged. Benefits of Beast Academy Puzzles 1 include: Engaging and Educational: Keeps minds active and spirits high as students tackle each new challenge.

item.title: Mission to Mars Camp with Vex GO | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 8 – 12 July; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 8 and 9. In Mission to Mars, campers will first explore designing and building with VEX GO to create tools and devices for their astronaut to complete a mission to Mars. Then, they will build the Code Base and code it to collect geological samples and clear an area for a future Mars landing.

item.title: Programming Outdoor Fun with Lego Spike Essential | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 10 – 14 June; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm. Ages 6 and 7. This 5-day camp is designed to immerse students in an engaging STEAM-centric environment, offering practical experiences that enhance their skills in the areas of science, technology, engineering, the arts, and mathematics. The program emphasizes the development of 21st-century competencies, including social and emotional learning, foundational principles of computational thinking, beginner-level coding, mathematics, and language arts.

item.title: Python Camp | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: 10 – 14 June; Ages 10 to 13 Mornings 8:30 am to 1:00 pm Afternoons 12:30 to 5:00 pm Full Day 8:30 am to 5:00 pm Early Bird Discounts: Full-Day Mornings Afternoons Reserve and Pay Later: Full-Day Mornings Afternoons Beginners. Students with no prior exposure to text coding languages will follow the Banana Tales course. Instructors from Blue Ridge Boost will deliver live, interactive lessons that captivate and engage students.

item.title: Ready, Set, GO! | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 29 July – 2 August; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 8 and 9. Campers will engage in building and racing various cars to explore the concepts of forces and speed! They will start by constructing a Super Car and experimenting with ways to enhance its distance and speed. Over the course of the camp, they will expand on this foundation by assembling different models of the Super Car.

item.title: Roblox Beginners | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: 17 – 21 June; Ages 10 to 13 Mornings 8:30 am to 1:00 pm Afternoons 12:30 to 5:00 pm Full Day 8:30 am to 5:00 pm Early Bird Discounts: Full-Day Mornings Afternoons Reserve and Pay Later: Full-Day Mornings Afternoons Beginners. Campers with no prior exposure to text coding languages will follow the Creating a Game in Roblox course. The "Creating a Game in Roblox" course provided by CodeHS offers an engaging and comprehensive introduction to game development within the Roblox platform, specifically tailored for educational use.

item.title: Roblox Beginners | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 17 – 21 June; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 8 and 9. The Roblox camp is designed to introduce students to the metaverse world of Roblox. Students will learn about the platform, explore the Roblox Studio game engine used to create games for Roblox, build an obstacle course ("obby"), add provided code scripts to the obbies, customize their game, and then publish their creations to Roblox for their friends and family to enjoy.

item.title: Robotics Camp with Sphero Bolt | Blue Ridge Boost
Scratch | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 12 – 16 August; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm. Ages 6 and 7. Ignite Creativity with Scratch Camp! This summer, give your child aged 8-9 the opportunity to dive into the world of coding with our Scratch Camp. Using Scratch, a kid-friendly programming language from MIT, campers will learn to code their own games, animations, and stories.

item.title: Solving Problems Wherever We Go | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 17 – 21 June; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm. Ages 6 and 7. This 5-day camp is designed to immerse students in an engaging STEAM-centric environment, offering practical experiences that enhance their skills in the areas of science, technology, engineering, the arts, and mathematics. The program emphasizes the development of 21st-century competencies, including social and emotional learning, foundational principles of computational thinking, beginner-level coding, mathematics, and language arts.

item.title: Space Adventure Camp with Lego Spike Prime | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 5 – 9 August; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 8 and 9. Campers will embark on a "space adventure" using robots, where they construct various robotic structures designed for this level. They will learn to control the motors to enable the robots to execute precise movements around models of the "earth," "moon," and "sun." After encountering various obstacles, campers will utilize a force sensor to navigate past them successfully.

item.title: Vex Adventures in Engineering | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 22 – 26 July; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 8 and 9. Campers will engage in designing and building with VEX GO to bring their creative ideas to life! Through a series of activities and challenges, they will ideate, iterate, design, build, and test their creations. This hands-on experience will deepen their understanding of the design process and the mechanisms and mechanics that underpin how things function.

item.title: Vex On the Move Camp | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 8–12 July; 8:30 am to 1 pm; Ages 10 to 13. VEX IQ Robotics Summer Camp is a program that introduces campers to the fundamentals of robotics and teamwork. Campers build a VEX IQ Simple Clawbot and test different driver configurations to find the most effective setup. They design and construct manipulators to enhance their robot's goal-scoring abilities in a Robot Soccer competition.

item.title: Vex Search and Rescue Camp | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: 17 – 21 June; Ages 10 to 13 Mornings 8:30 am to 1:00 pm Afternoons 12:30 to 5:00 pm Full Day 8:30 am to 5:00 pm Early Bird Discounts: Full-Day Mornings Afternoons Reserve and Pay Later: Full-Day Mornings Afternoons In this hands-on robotics camp, students will work collaboratively to construct a VEX IQ Clawbot, a versatile robot known for its capability to grasp and manipulate objects. The initial challenge involves assembling the Clawbot and programming it to efficiently transport objects from one location to another, utilizing both manual drive control and automated coding strategies.

item.title: Vex123 Move it! Shake it! | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 22 – 26 July; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 6 and 7. The adventure kicks off as students program their robots to navigate a predefined path, giving them their initial experience in motion control. The excitement builds as they delve into coding dance movements, transforming their robots into lively partying peacocks, showcasing their creativity and understanding of motion sequences.

item.title: Vex123 Space Race | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Ages 6 and 7. One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 15 – 19 July; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 6 and 7 In the morning, campers are introduced to the Vex123 Robot, through an engaging narrative, and they learn essential protocols for interacting with the robot. Participants then envision their robot as a Mars rover, embarking on various missions such as programming it to gather samples and bring them back to base camp for shipment to Earth.

item.title: Web Design | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: One Payment:   Full-Day Half-Day Three Payments:   Full-Day Half-Day 24 – 28 June; 8:30 am to 1 pm or 5:00 pm; Ages 11 to 13. This is a 5 day project-based camp that teaches students how to build their own web pages. Students will learn the languages HTML and CSS, and will create their own homepages to serve as portfolios of their creations. By the end of this course, students will be able to explain how web pages are developed and viewed on the Internet, analyze and fix errors in existing websites, and create their very own webpage!
